page.title: 01The Kennet West of Reading
page.content: The flat Kennet valley rises to low hills to the south and east. The land near to the river is in productive, mainly arable , agricultural use. In the remaining, hillier part, commercial coniferous plantations predominate, interspered with isolated dwellings. There are small communities at Ufton Nervet and Padworth. More dwellings are concentrated at Aldermaston wharf, close to the intersection of the principal A4 and A340 roads, and the main London to Exeter railway. There is a small railway station. The Kennet and Avon canal is close to the railway line and is being restored. Two new locks (1985) and an unusual semi-bascule bridge (1981) have been built at Aldermaston wharf, which once served a brewery but is now little used.
